1.definition: to end (a joint tenancy) by ending one or all of the unities of time, title, possession, or interest (as by conveying one tenant's interest to another party)

2.definition: to separate (as a contract) into different parts (as independent obligations) in order to treat each separately

3 a.definition: to try (criminal offenses or defendants) separately in order to avoid prejudice

sub_terms.b: to split (a criminal trial) into multiple trials in order to avoid prejudice
sub_terms.c: to try (civil claims or issues pleaded in the same case) separately
